responses: 1: Unregulated: Changes in chief executive occur through forceful seizures of power.
2: Designational/Transitional: Chief executives are chosen by designation within the political
elite, without formal competition (i.e., one-party systems or "rigged" multiparty elections).
3: Regulated: Chief executives are determined by hereditary succession or in competitive
question: Are there rules in recruiting the executive?
name: e_xrreg
